Name: Irish Flag
Ingredients: 15 ml Giffard Peppermint Pastille crème de menthe
15 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
Instructions: LAYER in chilled glass by carefully pouring ingredients in the order listed.
Review: Tricoloured orange and mint smoothed with cream liqueur.
History: The Irish tricolour is the national flag of the Republic of Ireland. Its three equal stripes represent the political landscape. Orange stands for the Protestants because of William of Orange, the Protestant king of England who defeated the Roman Catholic James II in 1690. Green stands for the Catholic nationalists of the south and white for the the hope of peace between Catholics and Protestants.
